required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Longitudinal Study of Empathy Levels in Physiotherapy Students
clinical_study.official_title: A Four-Year Longitudinal Study of Empathy Levels in Undergraduate Physiotherapy Students

brief_summary.textblock: 'Empathy' is a core term of occupations related to health sciences like physiotherapy. In physiotherapy education programs, empathy is necessary to have a successful cooperation with the clients. This study was planned to follow the changes of empathy levels in physiotherapy students of a four-year bachelor program and therefore enhance the curriculum related to the results. To the best of our knowledge, this research is the first longitudinal study about empathy levels of students in Turkey. Hypotheses: Empathy levels of the students increase year by year (1). Female students are more empathetic than male ones (2).

detailed_description.textblock: Totally 120 physiotherapy students at a non-governmental university in Istanbul participated in this study. The Turkish reworded student version of the Jefferson scale of physician empathy was used. Empathy scores were compared related to study years and gender. Empathy scores relevant to gender were compared using Mann-Whitney U test. The Kruskal-Wallis one-way analysis of variance was used for differences among the four study years.

primary_outcome.description: It was measured if the empathy levels of the students increase year by year

secondary_outcome.description: It was measured if female students are more empathetic than male ones

clinical_study.condition: Longitudinal Study of Empathy Levels in Physiotherapy Students

arm_group.description: Totally 120 physiotherapy students at a non-governmental university in Istanbul participated in this study.

intervention.description: The Turkish reworded student version of the Jefferson scale of physician empathy was used. Empathy scores were compared related to study years and gender.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- attending the first through fourth year of physiotherapy department
- being willing to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
do not continue in physiotherapy department

reference.citation: Chen PJ, Huang CD, Yeh SJ. Impact of a narrative medicine programme on healthcare providers' empathy scores over time. BMC Med Educ. 2017 Jul 5;17(1):108. doi: 10.1186/s12909-017-0952-x.

Hojat M, Gonnella JS. Eleven Years of Data on the Jefferson Scale of Empathy-Medical Student Version (JSE-S): Proxy Norm Data and Tentative Cutoff Scores. Med Princ Pract. 2015;24(4):344-50. doi: 10.1159/000381954. Epub 2015 Apr 28.
